byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and NIKITA STEWART

abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio unveils $77.7 billion 2016 budget, up 3.6 percent from previous year, that contains new spending on public safety and social programs, such as bulletproof vests for police, funds to aid the homeless and increased emergency response time.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s initial plan for the 2016 fiscal year relies on prosperity to support a budget that includes no tax increases and virtually no service cuts.

headline.main: In de Blasio’s Budget Plan, an Emphasis on Public Safety and Social Programs
headline.print_headline: In de Blasio’s Budget Plan, an Emphasis on Public Safety and Social Programs

snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio’s initial plan for the 2016 fiscal year relies on prosperity to support a budget that includes no tax increases and virtually no service cuts.
